title: How to Send an iMessage to Japan: Simple Steps for iPhone Users

steps.title: Open the Messages app.
steps.content: Open the Messages app. It's the green speech bubble icon located on your iPhone's home screen.

steps.title: Tap the new message button.
steps.content: Tap the new message button. It's the pencil and paper icon in the top right corner of the Messages screen.

steps.title: Type in "+."
steps.content: Type in "+." Doing so will automatically fill out your country's exit code, and you'll want to do this if you're sending a message from outside of Japan. [1] X Research source Alternatively, you can type in your full country exit code. Check http://www.howtocallabroad.com/codes.html for a list of all the country codes.

steps.title: Type in "81."
steps.content: Type in "81." 81 is the Japanese country code.

steps.title: Type in a person's phone number.
steps.content: Type in a person's phone number.

steps.title: Tap the message field.
steps.content: Tap the message field. It's the blank field just above the right side of the keyboard.

steps.title: Tap the blue up arrow to send.
steps.content: Tap the blue up arrow to send. Your iMessage will be sent to your recipient in Japan!
